unknown-types-last30.description: Number of authentication packets of unknown types in the last 30 minutes.

radius-server-para-info-type.description: Configure the inbound and outbound rate for the service policy template.

server-status-changes.description: List of status change information about a RADIUS server.

server-status-change.description: Operational state of status change information about a RADIUS server.

record-index.description: Record index of status change information about a RADIUS server.

change-time.description: Time when the status of a RADIUS server changes.

radius-detect-recorver.description: Configure detect for RADIUS authentication/accounting server state recovery.

dead-count.description: To configure the dead count for all radius servers in the virtual system.

dead-interval.description: To configure the dead interval for all the radius servers in the virtual system.

dead-time.description: To configure the dead time for all the radius servers in the virtual system.

fail-rate.description: Configure the fail rate for all the RADIUS servers in the virtual system.

server-recovery-on-response.description: Enable/disable server recovery on response for all the RADIUS servers in the virtual system.

authen-client-identifier.description: Radius client identifier for authentication purposes.

radius-server-groups.description: List of a set of RADIUS group.

retransmission-count.description: Number of times packet retransmission will happen if server is not responding.

auth-retransmission-count.description: Number of retransmission times of RADIUS authentication request packets if the server is not responding.

auth-retransmission-interval.description: Authentication response timeout interval of the RADIUS server.

acct-retransmission-count.description: Number of retransmission times of RADIUS accounting request packets if the server is not responding.

acct-retransmission-interval.description: Accounting response timeout interval of the RADIUS server.

shared-key.description: Shared-key value for a particular group. The simple password length ranges from 1 to 128, and the cipher password length ranges from 1 to 268.

group-mode.description: To configure mode (primary secondary and load balance) for a particular group. You are advised to use the leaf '/radius/radius-server-groups/radius-server-group/radius-server-algorithm/radius-arithmetic'.

source-interface-name.description: To configure source interface name at group level.

domain-mode.description: Configure domain mode of RADIUS server group.

alarm-enable.description: Enable/disable the RADIUS server alarm function.

radius-server-ipv4.description: Configure server for a particular group.

server-port.description: Configured server port for a particular server.

vpn-name.description: Set VPN instance.

shared-key.description: To configure shared-key value for a particular server. The simple password length ranges from 1 to 128, and the cipher password length ranges from 1 to 268.

source-ip.description: Source ip address or source interface of a RADIUS server.

ip.description: Specify the source IP address of a RADIUS server.

source-ip-address.description: Specify the source IP address of a RADIUS server.

interface.description: Specify the source interface of a RADIUS server.

is-current-server.description: Enable/disable the server as current server.

ip-account-packet-statistic.description: Statistics of Accounting packet about a specified RADIUS server IP address.

start-packet-number.description: Number of Accounting Start packets in the buffer queue.

stop-packet-number.description: Number of Accounting Stop packets in the buffer queue.

interim-packet-number.description: Number of Accounting Interim-Update packets in the buffer queue.

force-account-stop-packet.description: Configure accounting stop packets to be sent forcibly.

enable.description: Enable/disable accounting stop packets to be sent forcibly.

radius-hw-dhcp-options.description: List of configuring the device to send IPv4 DHCP options in the hw-dhcp-option attribute of authentication requests.

radius-hw-dhcp-option.description: Configure the device to send IPv4 DHCP options in the hw-dhcp-option attribute of authentication requests.

hw-dhcpv6-options.description: List of configuring the device to send IPv6 DHCP options in the hw-dhcpv6-option attribute of authentication requests.

hw-dhcpv6-option.description: Configure the device to send IPv6 DHCP options in the hw-dhcpv6-option attribute of authentication requests.

accounting-include-hw-dhcp-option.description: Configure the device to send options in the hw-dhcp-option and hw-dhcpv6-option attribute.

items.description: Configure the device to send IPv4 DHCP options in the hw-dhcp-option attribute of accounting requests.
Configure the device to send IPv6 DHCP options in the hw-dhcpv6-option attribute of accounting requests.

version-type.description: Configure the RADIUS version used between the router and a RADIUS server.

type.description: The RADIUS version used between the router and a RADIUS server.

interim-accout-resend-count.description: Enables RADIUS real-time accounting packet caching and configures the number of real-time accounting packet retransmissions.

start-accout-resend-count.description: Configure the number of times that cached accounting-start packets are retransmitted to the RADIUS accounting server in a RADIUS server group.

stop-accout-resend-count.description: Configure the number of times that cached accounting-stop packets are retransmitted to the RADIUS accounting server in a RADIUS server group.

packet-priority.description: Sets the DSCP value for RADIUS packets sent by the device to a RADIUS server.

vas-account-packed-max-length.description: Sets the maximum length for a post-merging accounting packet for value-added services.

ncp-up-send-start-account.description: Enable/disable the router to send Accounting Start packets to the RADIUS server after NCP goes Up for PPPv6 users that use DHCPv6 to obtain IPv6 addresses.

test-aaa-send-account-start.description: Enable/disable the router to send Accounting Start packets to the RADIUS server upon the test-aaa command execution.

encode-option61-to-attribute153.description: Enable/disable the device to encapsulate the Option61 field into the No.153 proprietary attribute on the RADIUS server, hw-user-mac attribute.

decode-fail-ignore-hw-data-filter.description: Enable/disable a device to ignore a RADIUS attribute if the device fails to parse this attribute.

frame-ip-mask.description: Enable/disable a device to add a 32-bit Framed-IP-Netmask attribute to an Accounting-Request packet. By default, an Accounting-Request packet does not carry a 32-bit Framed-IP-Netmask attribute.

service-type-outbound-vas-enable.description: Enable/disable the value-added-service when the Service-Type attribute value as 5 in common IPoE users' authentication and accounting request packets sent to the RADIUS server.

attribute-format-called-station-id.description: Enable/disable RADIUS attribute format of Called-Station-Id.

include-type.description: Radius server attribute format of called-station-id.

head-delimiter.description: Configure the user-defined format of the Called-Station-Id include delimiter.

include-attributes.description: List of the user-defined format of the Called-Station-Id attributes.

include-attribute.description: Configure the user-defined format of the Called-Station-Id attribute.

attribute-type.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter one.

delimiter.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter.

attribute-format-calling-station-id.description: Configure radius server attribute format of calling-station-id.

include-type.description: Radius server attribute format of calling-station-id.

head-delimiter.description: Configure the user-defined format of the Calling-Station-Id include delimiter.

include-attributes.description: List of the user-defined format of the Calling-Station-Id attributes.

include-attribute.description: Configure the user-defined format of the Calling-Station-Id attribute.

attribute-type.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter one.

delimiter.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter.

attribute-calling-station-id-lns-default.description: Configure the LNS to encapsulate the Calling-Station-Id attribute into RADIUS authentication and accounting packets in the default version1 format.

lns-version.description: Configure the LNS to encapsulate the Calling-Station-Id attribute into RADIUS authentication and accounting packets in the default version1 format.

attribute-vendor-id.description: Enable/disable the ID of a vendor whose private RADIUS attribute the device can parse.

nas-port-id-format.description: Configure the format of the NAS-Port or NAS-Port-Id attribute.

format.description: Configure the format of the NAS-Port or NAS-Port-Id attribute.

vendor-id.description: Specifies the ID of a supplier.

vendor-version.description: Indicates the version format for specified vendor to encapsulate the NAS-Port-Id attribute.

attribute-include-nas.description: Configure the automatic LAC receiving NAS-PORT attribute.

nas-port-enable.description: Enable/disable the automatic LAC receiving NAS-PORT attribute.

with-user-id-accounting-request.description: Enable/disable encapsulate type in the nas-port Attribute.

traffic-unit.description: Sets the traffic unit for a RADIUS server.

packet-format.description: Configure the format of packets that inform the upstream device of the link ID.

password-type.description: Sets the mode in which the RADIUS server sends a tunnel password to simple text or cipher.

refer-option82.description: Enable/disable authentication and accounting request packets to use the Connect-Info attribute to carry the uplink and downlink rates negotiated between the BRAS and DSLAM.

sub-slot.description: Enable/disable the system to use the interface number format of slot number/sub-slot number/interface number in the calling-station-ID and NAS-port-ID attributes.

nas-port-value.description: Enables the system to use the NAS-port-ID attributes.

if-domain-blocked.description: Configure an access policy for users if the domain delivered by the RADIUS server is blocked.

author-reply-user-name-policy.description: Enable/disable the device to reply with a CoA/DM response packet that carries the same user name as that in a CoA/DM request packet.

local-coa-enable.description: Enable/disable a user name adding policy for CoA response packets.

local-dm-enable.description: Enable/disable a user name adding policy for DM response packets.

update-domain-name.description: Enable/disable devices in a RADIUS server group to replace the domain name carried in a user name with the domain name delivered by the RADIUS server.

hw-mng-ipv6-motm-enable.description: Enable/disable the encapsulation format and name of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-encapsulating-name.description: Specifies the encapsulation format and name of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-delimiter.description: Specifies a delimiter of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-exclude-local.description: Enable/disable that the local configuration is excluded of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

ipoe-user-name-apply.description: Enable/disable the router to replace the IPoE user name generated on the router with the user name delivered by the RADIUS server.

ipoe-priority-apply.description: Enable/disable RADIUS server delivered user name replaces the IPoE user name generated on the router with a higher priority than the user name in the Service identity policy.

pppoe-user-name-apply.description: Enable/disable the router to replace the PPPoE user name generated on the router with the user name delivered by the RADIUS server.

replace-ipv6-pools-with-same-type.description: Enable/disable an IPv6 address pool to be delivered by a RADIUS server using the Framed-IPv6-Pool attribute to replace the IPv6 address pools of the same type configured in a domain.

attribute-disable-account.description: Configure accounting stop packets to be sent forcibly.

flow-attributes.description: Enable/disable if you specify the flow-attributes parameter. The following RADIUS attributes are all disabled: Acct-Input-Octets, Acct-Output-Octets, Acct-Input-Packets, Acct-Output-Packets, Acct-Input-Gigawords, Acct-Output-Gigawords, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Octets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Octets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Packets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Packet, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Gigawords, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Gigawords.

hw-acct-update-address.description: Enable/disable the HW-Acct-Update-Address attribute when the attribute value is equal to a certain integer.

standard-attributes.description:
List of the standard RADIUS attributes.
Standard attributes cannot be disabled and extended attributes cannot be disabled on the same server at the same time.
Standard attributes cannot be translated and extended attributes cannot be translated on the same server at the same time.

translate-packet-type.description: Configure radius translate attributes by packet type.

translate-direction-type.description: Configure radius attributes by direction type.

disable-packet.description: Configure radius attributes by packet type.

disable-direction.description: Configure radius attributes by packet type.

items.description: Configure disable attribute for attribute value.

extend-attributes.description: List of the extend RADIUS attributes.

access-request.description: Enable/disable operate attribute for access request packet.

access-accept.description: Enable/disable operate attribute for access accept packet.

account.description: Enable/disable operate attribute for account packet.

vendor-specifics.description: List of the vendor specific RADIUS attribute.

vendor-specific.description: Configure the vendor specific RADIUS attribute.

operation-type.description: Operation type of vendor specific attribute.

radius-server-algorithm.description: Configure algorithm of a RADIUS server.

radius-arithmetic.description: Sets the algorithm of a RADIUS server.

master-backup-rule.description: Indicates the rule of the active/standby algorithm.

rollover-on-reject.description: Configure a user fails to be authenticated by a RADIUS server in the group, the router sends an Access-Request packet to another RADIUS server until the user is authenticated or fails to be authenticated by any RADIUS servers.

enable.description: Enable/disable if a user fails to be authenticated by a RADIUS server in the group, the router sends an Access-Request packet to another RADIUS server until the user is authenticated or fails to be authenticated by any RADIUS servers.

llid-fail-disable-attribute.description: Configure radius attribute of Calling-Station-Id when LLID fail.

calling-station-id.description: Enable/disable radius attribute of Calling-Station-Id when LLID fail.

decode-hw-user-password-attribute.description: Configure the simple password decryption mode for the hw-user-password attribute (Huawei-proprietary attribute 33).

simple-coa-request.description: Enable/disable the simple password decryption mode for the hw-user-password attribute (Huawei-proprietary attribute 33).

assign-hw-pcp-server.description: Configure the HW-PCP-Server-Name attribute to be encapsulated into a specified DHCP/DHCPv6 option.

vendor-attribute-multiple.description: Configure the NE40E to carry multiple proprietary attributes in RADIUS attribute 26 Vendor-Specific.

other.description: Enable/disable the other proprietary attributes except the Huawei proprietary attribute, the Microsoft proprietary attribute, the 3GPP2 proprietary attribute, the RedBack proprietary attribute and the DSLForum proprietary attribute.

calling-station-id-format.description: Enable/disable PPPoE user calling_station_id in Redback format.

version1.description: Enable/disable using when calling-station-id is configed as redback format.

version3.description: Configure the Calling-Station-Id attribute to be encapsulated in the version3 format.

authen-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in user authentication and accounting packets.

bb-caller-id.description: Enable/disable No.97 RADIUS attribute, the private attribute of REDBACK.

hw-auth-type.description: Enable/disable No.180 RADIUS attribute, indicating the authentication type of users.

hw-product-id.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.255 attribute, which is used to indicate the device type.

hw-version.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.254 attribute, which is used to indicate the system software version.

cmcc-nas-type.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to distinguish between a non-forwarding-control separation device and a forwarding-control separation device.

cmcc-up-identifier.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to indicate the BRAS-UP ID.

cmcc-up-ip.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to indicate the IP address of the BRAS-UP.

avpair-subscriber-nas-type.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to distinguish between a non-forwarding-control separation device and a forwarding-control separation device.

avpair-subscriber-up-identifier.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to indicate the vBRAS-UP ID.

avpair-subscriber-up-ip.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to indicate the IP address of the vBRAS-UP.

lns-authen-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in LNS user authentication and accounting packets.

nas-port-id.description: Enable/disable No.87 RADIUS attribute. It is specific to scenarios in which the LNS sends request packets that need to carry the nas-port-id attribute to the LNS RADIUS server.

accounting-on-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS Accouting-On packet.

nas-ip-address.description: Enable/disable the NAS-IP-Address attributes to be added to RADIUS accounting-on packet.

event-time-stamp.description: Enable/disable a RADIUS Accouting-On packet to carry the event-timestamp attribute.

accounting-off-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS Accouting-Off packet.

nas-ip-address.description: Enable/disable the NAS-IP-Address attributes to be added to RADIUS accounting-off packet.

event-time-stamp.description: Enable/disable a Accounting-Off packet to carry the event-timestamp attribute.

coa-nak-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a coa-nak packet.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable the public No.18 attribute, which indicates the description of return character strings.

daa-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a DAA accounting packet.

class.description: Enable/disable the public No.25 attribute, which is used to take the accounting information.

edsg-authen-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in EDSG authentication and accounting packets.

hw-product-id.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.255 attribute, which is used to indicate the device type.

hw-version.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.254 attribute, which is used to indicate the system software version.

edsg-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a EDSG accounting packet.

class.description: Enable/disable the public No.25 attribute, which is used to take the accounting information.

user-offline-reason.description: Enable/disable detailed user offline reason in EDSG stop accounting-request packets.

user-mac.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.153 attribute, detailed user-mac in EDSG accounting-request packets.

accounting-request-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a accounting request packet.

hw-dhcpv6-option37.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.150 attribute, which is used to encapsulate the client MAC.

edsg-service-name.description: Enable/disable the EDSG service name. If the command is configured, it indicates the Huawei proprietary No.95 attribute. If the command is not configured, it indicates the Huawei proprietary No.185 attribute.

hw-acct-terminate-subcause.description: Enable/disable No.181 RADIUS attribute, indicating the ID of a subcause for a session interruption.

hw-avpair-nat-vpn.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates the VPN instance of the CGN ip pool.

hw-avpair-nat-extend-port.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates the extended port range.

hw-avpair-subscriber-fq.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates that the hw-avpair attribute in Accounting-request packets is used for sending effective Flow-queue parameters.

hw-avpair-subscriber-vpnid.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates that the hw-avpair attribute in Accounting-request packets is used for subscriber:vpnid.

hw-vpn-instance.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 94 attribute to be carried in accounting request packets. This attribute represents the VPN instance information. Specify this parameter if the upstream device needs to identify VPN instance information of users and implement service policies based on the VPN instance information in accounting request packets.

frame-route.description: Enable/disable the public No. 22 attribute. users' route information.

hw-web-url.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 253 attribute. the web users approve compulsive website.

hw-tunnel-group-name.description: Enable/disable the Huawei-proprietary No. 96 attribute, which identifies an L2TP or GRE group name.

hw-client-primary-dns.description: Enable/disable the Huawei-proprietary No. 135 attribute, which identifies the IP address of a primary DNS server.

hw-client-secondary-dns.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 136 attribute, which identifies the IP address of a secondary DNS server.

bod-account-attribute.description: Configure the attribute of bod account.

hw-nat-ip-adress.description: Enable/disable public network IP address after network address translation (NAT).

hw-nat-start-port.description: Enable/disable starting port of the public network IP address after NAT in a centralized BRAS scenario.

hw-nat-end-port.description: Enable/disable ending port of the public network IP address after NAT in a centralized BRAS scenario.

coa-query-ack-attribute.description: Configure the attributes to be carried in the ACK packets that are replied to the RADIUS server in a COA-based query.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Reply-Message attribute saved upon CoA-based re-authentication success.

session-time-out.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Session-Timeout attribute to indicate the remaining duration of a user service.

acct-session-time.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Acct-Session-Time attribute to indicate the online duration of a user.

filter-id.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Filter-Id attribute to indicate the user group information.

access-request-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS access request packet.

hw-gateway-address.description: Enable/disable access authentication request packets of Layer 3 DHCPv4 access users to carry user gateway addresses when the packets are sent to a RADIUS server.

hw-avpair-link-address.description: Enable/disable access authentication request packets of Layer 3 DHCPv6 access users to carry the HW-AVPAIR attribute to indicate the user link-address information when the packets are sent to a RADIUS server.

coa-logon-ack-attribute.description: Configure the attributes to be carried in the ACK packets that are replied to the RADIUS server when CoA-based pre-authentication to authentication domain switchover is performed successfully.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable ACK packets to carry the Reply-Message attribute.

class-partial-match.description: Specifies the character string for approximate string matching of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-encode-format-name.description: Specifies the encapsulation format and name of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-delimiter.description: Specifies a delimiter of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-exclude-local.description: Enable/disable that the local configuration is excluded of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

nas-port-id.description: Configure the nas-port-id attribute of the RADIUS server can carry the IP address of the DSLAM recorded by the physical port description. After the configuration, the nas-port-id attribute of the RADIUS server is encapsulated according to the configuration format.

include-attributes.description: List of the user-defined format of the nas-port-id attributes.

include-attribute.description: Configure the user-defined format of the nas-port-id attribute.

attribute-type.description: Configures the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter one.

delimiter.description: Configures the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter.

head-delimiter.description: Configures the user-defined format of the nas-port-id include delimiter.

client-timeouts.description: The number of accounting timeouts to this server. After a timeout the client may retry to the same server, send to a different server, or give up. A retry to the same server is counted as a retransmit as well as a timeout. A send to a different server is counted as an Accounting-Request as well as a timeout.

This variable is incremented when an Accounting-Request is sent and decremented due to receipt of an Accounting-Response, a timeout or a retransmission.

client-timeouts.description: The number of accounting timeouts to this server. After a timeout the client may retry to the same server, send to a different server, or give up. A retry to the same server is counted as a retransmit as well as a timeout. A send to a different server is counted as an Accounting-Request as well as a timeout.
